intro: Mercurialis perennis subvar. alpina, commonly known as the alpine mercury, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local insect populations.
